line: Hello… I don’t know how to explain this. The office… it’s unstable. You’re the only one who can help.
'Furniture floats, time loops, the stapler… it whispers.'
You feel a strange vibration through the line, as if reality itself is humming. 'Yes… guide it carefully,' the voice says.
The office shifts subtly—time stabilizes, objects align, coworkers act more normally. But something feels… off.
The office collapses inward, folding into itself. You hear the visitor whisper: 'Perhaps chaos is the answer.' Then silence.
The office mutates into a strange hybrid reality. You realize… your apartment, the office, the calls—they’re all linked now.

choices.text: Look for a way to separate them.
